Race.SpecificTitle: City Marshal -- City Court, City of Denham Springs
Justice of the Peace -- Justice of the Peace Ward  1
Justice of the Peace -- Justice of the Peace Ward  5
Justice of the Peace -- Justice of the Peace Ward  6
Justice of the Peace -- Justice of the Peace Ward  7
Constable -- Justice of the Peace Ward  1
Constable -- Justice of the Peace Ward  5
Council Member(s) -- City of Denham Springs
PW PC Health Unit -- 5 Mills - PC - 10 Yrs.
Race.FullText: Shall the Parish of Livingston, State of Louisiana (the "Parish") renew the levy and collection of a special tax of five (5) mills on all property subject to taxation in the Parish (an estimated $762,782.00 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year) (the "Tax"), for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2015 and ending with the year 2024, for the purpose of acquiring sites for, and for constructing, improving, maintaining and operating the Parish health unit?

Race.SpecificTitle: Town of Killian -- 1/2% S&U - Mayor & TC
Race.FullText: Shall the Town of Killian be authorized to levy a one-half percent (1/2%) sales tax for operating the Town of Killian; currently, the estimated amount reasonably expected to be collected from the levy of said tax for one entire year is $6,000.00; this tax shall be levied beginning January 1, 2015, and be of unlimited duration and the private sales of all Registered Vehicles and Motor Craft shall be exempt from said tax; and shall the Town of Killian be authorized to use the proceeds of the sales tax as follows: all of said tax, after paying reasonable and necessary costs of collecting and administering the tax, shall be dedicated for use for the public safety?

Race.SpecificTitle: Recreation District No. 3 -- 15 Mills - BOC - 10 Yrs.
Race.FullText: Shall Recreation District No. 3 of Livingston Parish, Louisiana (the "District"), renew the levy and collection of a tax of fifteen (15) mills on all property subject to taxation within the District (an estimated $2,236,130 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year) (the "Tax"), for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2016 and ending with the year 2025, for the purpose of operating and maintaining said District?

Race.SpecificTitle: Fire Protection District No. 5 -- 10.14 Mills - BOC - 10 Yrs.
Race.FullText: Shall Fire Protection District No. 5 of the Parish of Livingston, State of Louisiana (the "District"), continue to levy under the authority of Article VI, Sections 30 & 32 of the Constitution of the state of Louisiana of 1974, the applicable provisions of Chapter 5, Chapter 6-A and Chapter 6-B of title 18 of the Louisiana Revised Statutes of 1950, as amended, and other constitutional and statutory authority, a tax of ten and fourteen hundredths (10.14) mills on all the property subject to taxation in the District (an estimated $966,661.00 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year) for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2015 and ending with the year 2024, for the purpose of maintaining, operating and developing the District's fire protection facilities, for purchasing fire trucks and other firefighting equipment, paying the cost of obtaining water for fire protection purposes, including charges for fire hydrants rentals and service and for the purpose of paying the cost of acquiring, improving, or constructing fire protection facilities of the District, constituting works of public improvements?
